tasks.task: Setting up windbreaks for livestock during winter
subtasks: Observing weather conditions and forecasts
Assessing livestock's nutritional needs
Providing additional feed or supplements based on temperature and wind chill
Positioning animals in sheltered areas
Evaluating pasture conditions for wind protection
Installing or adjusting windbreak structures like tree rows
Monitoring animal health and adjusting strategies as needed

tasks.task: Managing livestock during extreme winter weather
subtasks: Checking weather reports from the National Weather Service
Implementing feeding strategies to meet increased energy needs
Moving livestock to warmer areas or shelters
Adjusting management practices to protect against freezing rain and snow
Ensuring accessibility to feed and water during inclement weather
Preparing for potential cold temperatures, freezing rain, and snow
Assessing land and facilities for winter use
Implementing protective measures for crops and livestock
Storing supplies and equipment for winter maintenance
Training staff or helpers on winter safety protocols
